= Components =
(generated)


*Component items*:
  * *Trunk - rectus abdominis muscle (trunk-rectus-abdominis-muscle)*: flexion of trunk/lumbar vertebrae; keeping the internal organs intact and in creating intra-abdominal pressure, such as when exercising or lifting heavy weights
  * *Trunk - external intercostal muscles (trunk-external-intercostal-muscles)*: aid in quiet and forced inhalation
  * *Trunk - serratus posterior superior muscle (trunk-serratus-posterior-superior-muscle)*: elevate the ribs which aids in inspiration
  * *Trunk - semispinalis dorsi (thoracis) (trunk-semispinalis-dorsi-thoracis)*: extends vertebral column
  * *Trunk - transversus thoracis muscle (trunk-transversus-thoracis-muscle)*: depresses the ribs; aids in exertional expiration by decreasing the transverse diameter of the thoracic cage
  * *Trunk - subcostalis muscle (trunk-subcostalis-muscle)*: synergist in aiding the internal intercostal muscles with forced exhalation
  * *Trunk - transversus abdominis muscle (trunk-transversus-abdominis)*: compress the ribs and viscera, providing thoracic and pelvic stability
  * *Trunk - internal intercostal muscles (trunk-internal-intercostal-muscles)*: aid in forced expiration
  * *Trunk - serratus posterior inferior muscle (trunk-serratus-posterior-inferior-muscle)*: depress the lower ribs, aiding in expiration
  * *Trunk - abdominal internal oblique muscle (trunk-internal-oblique-muscle)*: compresses abdomen and rotates vertebral column
  * *Trunk - pyramidalis muscle (trunk-pyramidalis-muscle)*: tensing the linea alba
  * *Trunk - abdominal somatic receptors (trunk-abdominal-somatic-receptors)*: somatic sensation from skin of lower abdomen and lateral side of gluteal region
  * *Trunk - adrenal gland (adrenal-gland)*: releasing hormones in response to stress
  * *Trunk - abdominal external oblique muscle (trunk-abdominal-external-oblique-muscle)*: rotates torso
  * *Trunk - iliocostalis muscle (trunk-iliocostalis-muscle)*: extends and lateral flexes spine
  * *Trunk - interspinales muscles (trunk-interspinales-muscles)*: aid in extension and rotation of vertebral column
  * *Trunk - intertransversarii muscle (trunk-intertransversarii-muscle)*: aid in lateral flexion of vertebral column; acting bilaterally, stabilize vertebral column
  * *Trunk - levatores costarum muscles (trunk-levatores-costarum-muscles)*: elevate ribs, assisting respiration; assist with lateral flexion of vertebral column}
  * *Trunk - longissimus muscle (trunk-longissimus-muscle)*: extends spine
  * *Trunk - multifidus muscle (trunk-multifidus-muscle)*: stabilizes vertebrae in local movements of vertebral column
  * *Trunk - quadratus lumborum muscle (trunk-quadratus-lumborum-muscle)*: extension of lumbar vertebral column, with bilateral contraction; alone, lateral flexion of vertebral column; together, depression of thoracic rib cage
  * *Trunk - rotatores muscles (trunk-rotatores-muscles)*: facilitates the unilateral rotation and bilateral extension of the spine
  * *Trunk - semispinalis cervicis (trunk-semispinalis-cervicis-muscle)*: extends and rotates the head to the contralateral side and also extends the ribs
  * *Trunk - spinalis muscle (trunk-spinalis-muscle)*: lateral flexion of spine
